post: A wonderful morning with BRI's President David Bobb at the Civic Star Challenge Breakfast at  #NCSS2025. Thank you to all the teachers who joined us to celebrate civic learning and Americas 250th. Stay connected + access free resources:  https://bit.ly/4oqRng4  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #K12Teachers

I absolutely love them! The kids use them every day, highlighting & looking information up.   Lili V., New York educator $1 = 1 Pocket Constitution for a student in your state, right when theyre learning about their rights and responsibilities. Give now ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #SupportTeachers

The 2026 National Civics Bee begins with a written essay: students identify a local challenge, propose a solution, and connect it to founding principles and civic virtues. BRI helped shape the essay prompt and supporting materials so teachers and students have clear, rigorous guidance. 🔗 Details:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #WritingSkills  #StudentVoice

Day 1 at  #NCSS2025! Visit us at booths 408, 410, and 412 to explore classroom-ready civics lessons, games, and Americas 250th resources. Join our network for free materials:  https://bit.ly/4oqRng4  #CivicEducation  #TeachingHistory  #K12

As winter break approaches, one small civic activity can keep classroom momentum going. Log 1 A250-aligned lesson or discussion and your class is entered for Decembers Civic Star prizes. How are you building civic learning this month? 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #StudentEngagement  #K12  #TeachingResources

Were all set for  #NCSS2025! From unboxing to booth setup, our team is ready to meet educators and share resources that support impactful civics instruction. Stay connected + access free materials:  https://bit.ly/4oqRng4  #CivicEducation  #SocialStudies  #TeachingResources

📜 The 2026 National Civics Bee is now open to 6th-8th graders, and BRI is honored to serve as the Bees official content partner. Our team designs the questions, study materials, and essays that power every round of the competition. Share this opportunity with a student or colleague:  https://lnkd.in/esNd4QDK  #NationalCivicsBee  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice  #YouthLeadership

📜  #OTD in 1838, Frederick Douglass boarded a northbound train from Baltimore, taking the courageous step that secured his freedom and launched his lifelong work for equality and justice. How can his story help students consider the meaning of liberty? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/48hc2hS  #TDiH  #AmericanHistory  #CivicEducation

Stop by booths 408, 410, and 412 for live demos of our classroom games at  #NCSS2025. Experience how our resources help students practice civic reasoning in fun, meaningful ways. Sign up for updates + free materials:  https://lnkd.in/eVcfCStV  #CivicEducation  #GameBasedLearning  #SocialStudies

Students nationwide are sharing their civic-impact stories through the MyImpact Challenge. If you know a student making a difference, encourage them to take the next step. Learn more:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #YouthLeadership  #CivicEngagement  #ServiceLearning
